definition: to pressure/to press/to force/to compel/to push/to coerce/to urge/to impel/to bully into/to be compelled
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: I didn't want to do it, but he forced me to.
sentences.chinese: 我不想做這件事，但他硬逼着我做。

sentences.english: They wrung the truth out of me in the end.
sentences.chinese: 最後他們硬逼着我說出了真相。

sentences.english: The history teacher who had dragooned me into taking the exam is a nit-picking person.
sentences.chinese: 硬逼我去考試的歷史老師是個吹毛求疵的人。

sentences.english: China would never be bullied into any change of its policy.
sentences.chinese: 要想硬逼中國改變政策是辦不到的。

sentences.english: He will never be bullied into any change of his standpoint.
sentences.chinese: 要想硬逼他改變自己的立場是辦不到的。

sentences.english: He hustled me into buying the car.
sentences.chinese: 他硬逼我買下那輛汽車。

sentences.english: We didn't need them, but she hustled us into buying them.
sentences.chinese: 我們不需要它們，但她硬逼我們買下。

definition: to insist on doing sth/must do it, despite everything
to instigate/to incite/to egg sb on
can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)
firmly set on doing sth/to insist on doing/determined in one's course of action
to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to cajole/to sweet talk sb into doing sth
let (one) have his way/as (one) pleases/at (one's) will
